hcaidcs 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Compare two data frames to identify cells which are different

data_compare.Rd

Used to identify cells which have changed between publications for later highlighting in Excel export. With thanks to Amy Mikhail for writing this function for me.

data_compare(currentdf, lastdf)

Arguments

currentdf

A data frame in wide format giving the values for the current publication.
lastdf

A data frame in wide format giving the values for the most recent publication prior to the one being prepared.

Value

A matrix specifying cells that have changed.

Examples

last_pub <- data.frame(org = c("a", "b", "c"),
jan16 = sample(1:100, 3, replace=T),
feb16 = sample(1:100, 3, replace=T),
mar16 = sample(1:100, 3, replace=T),
jan17 = sample(1:100, 3, replace=T))

# copy the last pub, but drop the oldest month
this_pub <- last_pub[c(1,3:5)]
# add new month
this_pub$feb17 <- sample(1:100, 3, replace=T)
# change one value only
this_pub$mar16[2] <- this_pub$mar16[2] + 1
# Checki it out:
this_pub
#>   org feb16 mar16 jan17 feb17
#> 1   a    16    50    78     4
#> 2   b     1    30    88    33
#> 3   c    47    74    18    41
highlight <- data_compare(this_pub, last_pub)
